result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew C Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system.

Defendant Andrew C Walker in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon. Defendant Andrew C Walker in custody. Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
BTC: 

15CF557- 9 months RCJ w/ CFTS

15CF647- 6 years WPS, 3 yrs init, 3 yrs es 

15CF845- Withheld sentence, 3 yrs probation to run consecutive to 15CF647

Conditions:
Remaining jail credit to be applied to 15CF647
Complete 40 hours of community service work - 15CF845
Provide DNA sample + pay fee, waive all other court costs
No contact with the victims
Pay restitution - State has 60 days to request 
No drugs or alcohol
Obtain GED
Obtain employment skills
Maintain fulltime employment
AODA Assessment
Mental Health Assessment
FAW

Eligible for CIP and SIB
